Ekonomi RI Diramal Melambat di Kuartal III-2019
04 Nov 2019, 05:45 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - Pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia pada kuartal III-2019 diproyeksi tumbuh melambat ke level 5,01%. Angka tersebut lebih rendah dibandingkan dengan laju pada kuartal II-2019 yang telah dirilih Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) yakni sebesar 5,05%."Pertumbuhan ekonomi kuartal III tahn 2019 diperkirakan berkisar 5,01% dari kuartal sebelumnya tercatat 5,05%," kata Ekonom Bank Permata Josua Pardede saat dihubungi detikcom, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Josua mengungkapkan, penyebab melambatnya laju pertumbuhan ekonomi pada kuartal III-2019 antara lain menurunnya tingkat konsumsi rumah tangga. Dia memprediksi konsumsi rumah tangga berada di level 5,02% dari kuartal sebelumnnya yang tumbuh 5,17%.Lalu beberapa faktor pendukung pertumbuhan ekonomi seperti PMTB atau investasi juga meningkat tipis ke level 5,09%. Selanjutnya mengenai konsumsi Pemerintah yang tercermin dari belanja cenderung melambat lantaran penyerapannya kurang oke.Sementara itu Direktur Riset Center of Reform on Economics (CORE) Indonesia, Piter Abdullah Redjalam memprediksi pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia kuartal III-2019 berada di level 4,95-5,05%.Dia bilang perlambatan pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional dikarenakan konsumsi rumah tangga yang laju pertumbuhannya melambat dibandingkan kuartal sebelumnya."Pertumbuhan ekonomi triwulan 3 diperkirakan di kisaran 4,95 sampai dengan 5,05%. Pertumbuhan ekonomi cenderung melambat karena menurunnya pertumbuhan konsumsi rumah tangga yang pada triwulan 3 kami perkirakan bisa di bawah 5%," kata Piter.Tingkat konsumsi rumah tangga memberikan dampak terhadap pertumbuhan ekonomi karena memiliki kontribusi yang paling besar terhadap perekonomian Indonesia."Share pertumbuhan konsumsi terhadap pertumbuhan ekonomi mendekati 60%. Apabila pertumbuhan konsumsi masih bisa dipertahankan 5% maka pertumbuhan ekonomi pada triwulan 3 diyakini bisa di atas 5%," ungkap dia.Simak Video "Sandi: Pemerintah Terjebak Dalam Pertumbuhan Ekonomi 5%"[Gambas:Video 20detik](hek/ang)

RI's Economy Is Forecast Slowing in Quarter III-2019
Nov 04 2019, 05:45 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 is projected to grow slowly to a level of 5.01%. This figure is lower than the rate in the second quarter of 2019 which has been chosen by the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) which is at 5.05%. "Economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 is estimated to be around 5.01% from the previous quarter recorded at 5.05%, "Bank Permata economist Josua Pardede said when contacted by AFP, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019). Joseph revealed, the causes of slowing economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 included a decline in household consumption levels. He predicts household consumption to be at 5.02% from the previous quarter which grew 5.17%. Then several factors supporting economic growth such as PMTB or investment also increased slightly to the level of 5.09%. Furthermore, regarding Government consumption reflected by spending tends to slow down because absorption is not okay. Meanwhile, Research Director of the Indonesian Center for Reform on Economics (CORE), Piter Abdullah Redjalam predicts Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 to be at the level of 4.95-5.05 "He said the slowdown in national economic growth was due to household consumption, whose growth rate slowed compared to the previous quarter." Economic growth in the third quarter is estimated to be in the range of 4.95 to 5.05%. Economic growth tends to slow down due to declining growth in household consumption in we estimate that in the third quarter it could be under 5%, "said Piter. The level of household consumption has an impact on economic growth because it has the biggest contribution to the Indonesian economy." Share consumption growth to economic growth is approaching 60%. 5% then growth economy in the third quarter is believed to be above 5%, "he said.
